situation: M was in the cafeteria when the noise level increased drastically due to an unexpected fire drill, causing him to cover his ears and begin to rock back and forth.
action: The teacher aide quickly led M out of the cafeteria to a quieter hallway, handed him noise-canceling headphones, and spoke softly to reassure him. They used calming breathing techniques together until M felt centered.
effect: M was able to calm down and return to class without further distress, demonstrating an increased tolerance for returning to noisy environments as the noise-canceling headphones were effective. M returned to classes after agreeing to wear headphones next time.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
